### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.

- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

If using this code:
Get-Credential | export-clixml ./test.xml
#When Asked for the credentials leave password empty!!!
$test = import-clixml ./test.xml


### Expected behavior

```console
$test should have a credential object, with an empty password.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
On Linux this error is thrown:
"Import-Clixml: Cannot process argument because the value of argument "input" is not valid. Change the value of the "input" argument and run the operation again."
```


### Error details

```console
On Windows with 5.1 and 7.1.4 this works, but it seems due to the different encoding written to file on linux, that the xml cannot be reimported. This error is thrown:
"Import-Clixml: Cannot process argument because the value of argument "input" is not valid. Change the value of the "input" argument and run the operation again."
```
